intro: Fumaria officinalis var. parviflora, commonly known as the lesser celandine, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has a short growing season and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Its leaves and flowers contain various alkaloids, which have been used in traditional medicine.
